required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety Study in Patients With Advanced Prostate Cancer Treated With FIRMAGON
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Observational Safety Study in Patients With Advanced Prostate Cancer Treated With FIRMAGON (Degarelix) or a GnRH Agonist

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a large observational study, set-up to observe how long-term treatment with FIRMAGON (hormone regulator) compare to other treatments in regards to cardiovascular events, changes in bone density, changes in blood sugar levels or liver enzyme levels in subjects with prostate cancer. Subjects will be treated according to their routine clinical care and not dictated by the study. As the study is observational in nature, the study will collect data relating to the events specified above. Subjects that agree to this study will be followed-up for 5 years. Subject data will be collected every 3 months for the first 2 years and every 6 months for the last 3 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence Rate of Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESI): Cardiovascular Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline upto 5 years (every 3 months from the first 2 years of the study; every 6 months for the last 3 years of the study)
primary_outcome.description: The incidence rate (IR) expressed as number of events per 100 patient-years of exposure (PYE).

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence Rate of AESI: Decreased Bone Density
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline upto 5 years (every 3 months from the first 2 years of the study; every 6 months for the last 3 years of the study)
primary_outcome.description: IR of osteoporosis or osteopenia and bone fracture events are presented. The IR is expressed as number of events per 100 PYE.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence Rate of AESI: Glucose Intolerance or Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (T2DM)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline upto 5 years (every 3 months from the first 2 years of the study; every 6 months for the last 3 years of the study)
primary_outcome.description: IR of new onset or exacerbation of glucose intolerance or T2DM were presented. The IR expressed as number of events per 100 PYE. Glucose intolerance events were defined as events of levels of fasting glucose of 6.1 to 6.9 mmol/L

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline upto 5 years (every 3 months from the first 2 years of the study; every 6 months for the last 3 years of the study)
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in hepatic enzyme levels (alanine aminotransferase [ALT], aspartate aminotransferase [AST], and alkaline phosphatase [ALP]) are presented.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline upto 5 years (every 3 months from the first 2 years of the study; every 6 months for the last 3 years of the study)
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in hepatic enzyme level (bilirubin) is presented.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline upto 5 years (every 3 months from the first 2 years of the study; every 6 months for the last 3 years of the study)
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in serum glucose are presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number and Classification of New Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline upto 5 years (every 3 months from the first 2 years of the study; every 6 months for the last 3 years of the study)
secondary_outcome.description: An ADR was defined as an AE assessed by investigator as possibly/probably related to the investigational product. Any new potentially unrecognized ADRs were presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Long Term Evaluation of Clinical Evolution of Prostate Cancer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline upto 5 years (every 3 months from the first 2 years of the study; every 6 months for the last 3 years of the study)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in prostate specific antigen (PSA) is presented.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline upto 5 years (every 3 months from the first 2 years of the study; every 6 months for the last 3 years of the study)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in testosterone levels are presented.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline upto 5 years (every 3 months from the first 2 years of the study; every 6 months for the last 3 years of the study)
secondary_outcome.description: A summary of IRs of all-cause mortality is presented.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects with prostate cancer from primary care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosed with prostate cancer and indicated for androgen deprivation therapy (ADT)
- Decision made to prescribe ADT prior to enrolment
- Willing and able to provide written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participation in an interventional clinical study in which any treatment or follow-up is mandated
- Treatment with a GnRH receptor antagonist other than FIRMAGON
- Had previous or is currently under hormonal management of prostate cancer, except for subjects who have undergone therapy with curative intention where neoadjuvant/adjuvant therapy allowed for maximum 6 months. Treatment should be terminated at least 6 months prior to baseline.

Amalia Fleming General Hospital of Athens

Helse Nordmore og Romsdal HF, Kristiansund Sykehus

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 136 sites in 15 European countries (Belgium, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Slovakia, Switzerland, United Kingdom) recruited subjects to this observational study between January 2011 to April 2013, and the last subject completed the last visit in March 2018.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 1,515 subjects were screened, of which 1,493 subjects were found to be eligible and exposed to treatment; 1,000 subjects in the FIRMAGON group and 493 subjects in the gonadotrophin releasing hormone (GnRH) agonist group.

group.title: FIRMAGON
group.description: FIRMAGON (Degarelix, a GnRH antagonist) was prescribed in accordance with the approved label

group.title: GnRH Agonist
group.description: Any GnRH agonist prescribed in accordance with the approved labels

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Covers a diverse set of reasons

baseline.population: The safety analysis set comprised of all subjects treated with at least one dose of medicinal product. The data was restricted to main treatment period (from signing of informed consent and administration of first dose until loss to follow-up, change/discontinuation in androgen deprivation therapy [ADT], or end-of-study visit, whatever came first).

group.description: FIRMAGON (Degarelix, a GnRH antagonist) was prescribed in accordance with the approved label

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.population: Number analyzed differs from the overall population as baseline body mass index (BMI) was not calculated for some of the subjects.

outcome.title: Incidence Rate of Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESI): Cardiovascular Events
outcome.description: The incidence rate (IR) expressed as number of events per 100 patient-years of exposure (PYE).
outcome.time_frame: From baseline upto 5 years (every 3 months from the first 2 years of the study; every 6 months for the last 3 years of the study)
outcome.population: The safety analysis set comprised of all subjects treated with at least one dose of medicinal product. The data was restricted to main treatment period (from signing of informed consent and administration of first dose until loss to follow-up, change/discontinuation in ADT, or end-of-study visit, whatever came first).

group.title: FIRMAGON
group.description: FIRMAGON (Degarelix, a GnRH antagonist) was prescribed in accordance with the approved label

group.title: GnRH Agonist
group.description: Any GnRH agonist prescribed in accordance with the approved labels

measure.title: Incidence Rate of Adverse Events of Special Interest (AESI): Cardiovascular Events
measure.description: The incidence rate (IR) expressed as number of events per 100 patient-years of exposure (PYE).
measure.population: The safety analysis set comprised of all subjects treated with at least one dose of medicinal product. The data was restricted to main treatment period (from signing of informed consent and administration of first dose until loss to follow-up, change/discontinuation in ADT, or end-of-study visit, whatever came first).

analysis.groups_desc: The IRs were estimated using a Poisson-mixture regression model.
analysis.p_value_desc: Poisson-mixture regression was used to model the influence of age, stage of disease, and relevant medical history along with the treatment group effect on the number of events adjusted for individual study exposures measured in 100 PYE.
analysis.method_desc: The IRs for each treatment arm with 95% confidence interval (CI), and incidence rate ratio (IRRs) with 95% CI and p-values were based on Wald test.
analysis.estimate_desc: IRR for treatment with the lower 95% confidence limit >1 suggest increased risk of AESI; upper confidence limit <1 suggest decreased risk of AESI with the use of FIRMAGON. The limit including 1 suggests no difference b/w treatment groups.

outcome.description: IR of osteoporosis or osteopenia and bone fracture events are presented. The IR is expressed as number of events per 100 PYE.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline upto 5 years (every 3 months from the first 2 years of the study; every 6 months for the last 3 years of the study)
outcome.population: The safety analysis set comprised of all subjects treated with at least one dose of medicinal product. The data was restricted to main treatment period (from signing of informed consent and administration of first dose until loss to follow-up, change/discontinuation in ADT, or end-of-study visit, whatever came first).

analysis.groups_desc: For glucose intolerance. The IRs were estimated using Poisson-mixture regression model.
analysis.p_value_desc: Poisson mixture regression was used to model the influence of age, stage of disease, and history of diabetes mellitus along with the treatment group effect on the number of events adjusted for individual study exposures measured in 100 PYE.
analysis.method_desc: The IRs for each treatment arm with 95% CI, and IRRs with 95% CI and p-values were based on Wald test.
analysis.estimate_desc: IRR for treatment with the lower 95% confidence limit >1 suggest increased risk of AESI; upper confidence limit <1 suggest decreased risk of AESI with the use of FIRMAGON. The limit including 1 suggests no difference b/w treatment groups.

analysis.groups_desc: For T2DM. The IRs were estimated using Poisson-mixture regression model.
analysis.p_value_desc: Poisson-mixture regression is used to model the influence of age, stage of disease, and relevant medical history along with the treatment group effect on the number of events adjusted for individual trial exposures measured in 100 PYE.
analysis.method_desc: The IRs for each treatment arm with 95% CI, and IRRs with 95% CI and p-values were based on Wald test.
analysis.estimate_desc: IRR for treatment with the lower 95% confidence limit >1 suggest increased risk of AESI; upper confidence limit <1 suggest decreased risk of AESI with the use of FIRMAGON. The limit including 1 suggests no difference b/w treatment groups.

analysis.groups_desc: The analyses of all-cause mortality was based on logistic regressions.
analysis.p_value_desc: A logistic regression was used to model the influence of age, stage of disease and relevant medical history along with the treatment group on the time to event for all-cause mortality.
analysis.method_desc: Logistic regression was used to model the influence of age, stage of disease and relevant medical history along with the treatment group.

reported_events.time_frame: From baseline upto 5 years (every 3 months from the first 2 years of the study; every 6 months for the last 3 years of the study)
reported_events.desc: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a subject participating in a clinical investigation who received a pharmaceutical product. The safety analysis set comprised of all subjects treated with at least one dose of medicinal product. The data was restricted to main treatment period (from signing of informed consent and administration of first dose until loss to follow-up, change/discontinuation in ADT, or end-of-study visit, whatever came first).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Squamous cell carcinoma of the oral cavity

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review the draft manuscript prior to publication and can request delay of publication where any contents are deemed patentable by the sponsor or confidential to the sponsor. Comments will be given within four weeks from receipt of the draft manuscript. Additional time may be required to allow Ferring to seek patent protection of the invention.
